Text:
A rocket scientist once convinced me that the biggest obstacle to space tourism is not tech, nor cost but the fact there's *nothing to do* in space.

Text:
For Richard Branson, the Romance of Space Tourism Meets Reality

01MAY2021

Text:
Unpopular opinion:

Why do we feel the need in the community to hate on Blue Origin? The founder might not be the best, but the company and it‚Äôs vehicles are really cool! They are doing science and kickstarting space tourism, we should celebrate this, not belittle them.

This space tourism thing for the ultra wealthy needs to stop. It feels like we are unabashedly hurtling into the next industrial revolution unregulated, without sparing a thought for how it will affect the planet, the universe, and future generations.

.

Can we all agree that the term "space tourism" is stupid?

You're not touring space, you're moving from a cramped vehicle into a cramped satellite and looking at the same endless void you can see from the nights sky.

Call it space tourism when you can tour the moon's craters.
What if space tourism is all a ruse to get Jeff Bezos to agree to being fired into space, only to leave him out there?

Text: Space tourism is a cr*p idea and rich people traveling to space just because they can and because they can afford it is bullsh*t to a degree where I don't know where to begin so I'll just leave this "well articulated" tweet here.

$SPCE - Just read on reddit that Astronaut Sirisha Bandla just said on IG live that they are taking plants from the University of Florida to study gene expression during Sunday's flight. This isn't just about space tourism but also research.

I am all for private funding of space travel as long as it is helpful to the advancement of humanity, such as working on ways to get to Mars. I, however, am not sold on space tourism as an important endeavor.

Two Commercial Space Tourism companies...Blue Origin and Virgin Galactic. Jeff Bezo's Blue origin was set to be the first space tourism flight with an unknown bidder paying $28 million to be onboard. BUT Richard Branson apparently One Upped him, going THIS Sunday July 11.
Space tourism era ready for unofficial liftoff with Bezos and Branson on competing flights https://cbsn.ws/3yERY4u

Welcome to the competition for SPACE TOURISM!!!

Ignoring the minor details of "mine's better/bigger than yours" between companies, this is THE moment in history where everyone has an opportunity to go to space!!!

I'm excited!!

So a few weeks ago, 2 billionaires from earth visited space. The departure of Richard Branson and Jeff Bezos to space has undeniably brought space tourism a step closer to become reality.

New Shepard, a 60-foot rocket and capsule, was designed primarily for space tourism thanks to fully automated flight systems, meaning nobody was piloting the craft nor contributing to "human space flight safety."
